Package jrtr.glrenderer

Class GLRenderContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrtr.glrenderer.GLRenderContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RenderContext
    public class GLRenderContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements RenderContext
    Implements a RenderContext (a renderer) using OpenGL version 3 (or later).

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • sceneManager

        private SceneManagerInterface sceneManager

      • defaultShader

        private GLShader defaultShader
        The default shader for this render context.

      • activeShaderID

        private int activeShaderID
        The id of the currently active shader. Call useShader(Shader) and useDefaultShader() to switch between shaders.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GLRenderContext

        public GLRenderContext()
        This constructor is called by GLRenderPanel.

    • Method Detail

      • setSceneManager

        public void setSceneManager​(SceneManagerInterface sceneManager)
        Set the scene manager. The scene manager contains the 3D scene that will be rendered. The scene includes geometry as well as the camera and viewing frustum.
        Specified by:
        setSceneManager in interface RenderContext

      • display

        public void display()
        This method is called by the GLRenderPanel to redraw the 3D scene. The method traverses the scene using the scene manager and passes each object to the rendering method.

      • beginFrame

        private void beginFrame()
        This method is called at the beginning of each frame, i.e., before scene drawing starts.

      • endFrame

        private void endFrame()
        This method is called at the end of each frame, i.e., after scene drawing is complete.

      • draw

        private void draw​(RenderItem renderItem)
        The main rendering method.
        Parameters:
        renderItem - the object that needs to be drawn

      • initArrayBuffer

        private void initArrayBuffer​(GLVertexData data)
        A utility method to load vertex data into an OpenGL "vertex array object" (VAO) for efficient rendering. The VAO stores several "vertex buffer objects" (VBOs) that contain the vertex attribute data.
        Parameters:
        data - reference to the vertex data to be loaded into a VAO

      • setTransformation

        private void setTransformation​(javax.vecmath.Matrix4f transformation)

      • setMaterial

        private void setMaterial​(Material m)
        Set up a material for rendering. Activate its shader, and pass the material properties, textures, and light sources to the shader.
        Parameters:
        m - the material to be set up for rendering

      • cleanMaterial

        private void cleanMaterial​(Material m)
        Disable a material. To be implemented in the "Textures and Shading" project.

      • useShader

        public void useShader​(Shader s)
        Activate and use a given shader.
        Specified by:
        useShader in interface RenderContext
        Parameters:
        s - the shader to be activated

        public void useDefaultShader()
        Activate the default shader.
        Specified by:
